Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay, overall.”
Reviews.Author: SailingPT
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, overall. The rooms were very comfortable: a mix between modern deco with some more classical touches. We had a balcony, which was very nice to sit on in the evenings. The hotel is within easy walking distance to all the major attractions. We were a family of four, and asked for two adjoining rooms, which they didn't have for the first night, but the move into the rooms for the following nights was hassle-free. Breakfast was good, with plenty to choose from (continental, warm & cold food, and Turkish food), but the staff kept trying to get us to buy fresh orange juice ("It's very good for the children", they would say), which was a bit annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ralph H
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great location, affordable rates, clean rooms and helpful staff. I you are lucky you can get a room with a water view. The free breakfast is excellent. The location is a couple of blocks below the Blue Mosque and walking distance to the museums and several resturants. The bar on the top floor has a great view and you can sit indoors or on the veranda. The resturant is okay but slow and very under utilized. There is also a free computer you can use for emails.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: Ellen G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated in the historic quarter so that you're within walking distance to the great sites. The building itself is charming, and the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful (like all Turkish people). The room was very small--I had two single beds--but that's what I expect in a boutique hotel in a big city. I was in the back of the building where the train track is, but it did not bother me at all, and I probably wouldn't have noticed it had I not read other reviews before arriving. Breakfast is delicious--ceareals, meats, cheeses, coffee, tea, and--my personal favorite--COOKIES. How can you not like cookies for breakfast??? I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again when I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: Khweiriano
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel 3 Years ago (ignore tripadvisor date) for my honeymoon but I'm now indebted to Tripadvisor for letting me judge future places to stay and thus will begin writing reviews. Quick Summary: Pros: Location (very small 5min beautiful walk to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia) Friendly Staff Clean and comfortable rooms with good air con. Breakfast is plentiful Safe Box Cons (constructive): One computer with internet near lobby (this may have changed) Rooms are small but top floor had lovely balcony. Had to be moved due to double booking but this was done efficiently Breakfast never changes. Nothing spectacular or wow feel about hotel. Overall a good place to stay if u want something in easy walking distance of Blue Mosque etc. Tips: Arrange a shuttle from airport or book cheap taxi as we were 25Euros lighter after our expedition (we found place doing it for 10Euros round the corner from hotel). If you want cheap food to get by then eat the corn on cob, the bread, the kebabs. Not much flavour but get the job jone. Avoid naff cafe restaurants. Avoid being pulled to carpet shops. Avoid chemical apple tea, drink the real stuff. Always barter, treat the liras as pounds and you will do ok. Avoid taxis as they don't speak English. Buses are cheap. Trams are good. Eminomou was good stop with short walk to spice bazaar and across bridge to get to Taksim square. Lastly buy the Baclava, its expensive but delicious, rich and juicy. The cube shape ones are the best with chocolate flavour wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Top location and staff but a few let-downs”
Reviews.Author: pbs1986
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The positives: - - Location: literally 2 minutes' walk from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia, with the Topkapi Palace and Grand Bazaar nearby. Lots of restaurants nearby. We were able to walk to most of the places - Staff: very helpful and friendly, and saw to any problems we had quickly - Breakfast: a good selection of food, although you have to pay extra for fruit juice and eggs that aren't boiled Now the negatives: - - The double room was quite small and cramped, as was the bathroom which was smaller than those encountered on cruise ships! - Some stains on the cushions in the room - Lots of noise at night in the corridors from people coming back late - If you have a ground room floor facing towards the sea then your view is not of the sea but of what appears to be a derelict wooden building. There is a small balcony but with that view you wouldn't really want to sit there. In addition you'll be kept awake by the train line which runs right by the hotel. You'll probably have these problems even if you're on a higher floor. You do get a very good view from the restaurant on the top floor though. Overall what made our stay enjoyable was the staff and location. Would I stay here again though? Maybe not.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, helpful staff and clean, comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth_Sansom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really convenient area for the Arasta Bazaar and Blue Mosque, covered bazaar etc. The rooms are not large but quite sufficient and very clean and comfortable. The staff could not be more helpful. The area is full of charm and cobbled streets with great value restaurants. The food in the hotel itself is very good. There is no lift so if you are not able to do stairs it would not be for you as the breakfast buffet room is downstairs and the lunch & evening restaurant is on the second floor and the rooms are spread over 3 floors,

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Viscon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here five nights. Staff good very helpful. had an excellent Room with great views room very clean and kept that way throughout our stay. Charging for tea and coffee in the room poor, take your own. Juice is charged for at breakfast but is of high quality. No lifts so be prepared to climb. Location good but beware of some of the surrounding restaurants as many serve poor quality food but some are great. Did not eat in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One redeeming feature..”
Reviews.Author: themutiman
Reviews.Content: Negatives: very small rooms, no independent way to manage heating, paper thin walls so noisy, the train (I managed to 'learn' the timetable!) hurtles by but a stone's throw from the window, challenging to enter 'shower' (very high), charging for sachets of Nescafe. Breakfast: awful beyond words. No fruit, extra charge for juice, eggs. Rubbish coffee. Positives: one redeeming feature was the brutal torrent from the shower (accidental, I presume), location is useful. Istanbul: hard-sell hassle which is annoying.The roads are challenging too. Overall impression of Avicenna Hotel: ludicrous to label this as a 4 star. I would give it no more than a single star. Not a pleasant please at all. Best avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Cymro36
Reviews.Content: With this hotel, location is everything, being literally a couple of minutes' walk from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Topkapi Palace, while the Grand Bazaar is within easy walking distance. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room comfortable and clean, with a fridge/minibar, safe deposit and TV which received BBC World. We had a balcony but didn't use it as there was no view and it had snowed just before we arrived, so we weren't going to sit outside! Although centrally located, the hotel is in a back-street, so that it was quiet at night - although we were aware of the railway at the rear, it didn't disturb us at all. Breakfast in the basement was O.K. but not great. Others have mentioned the rather eccentric practice of charging for orange juice and for tea-bags in the room, so I shan't labour the point except to say that at the end of our stay these "extras" didn't add up to a huge amount. We didn't eat in the restaurant so can't comment on it, though others who ate there said it was fine. In any case, there are plenty of good restaurants nearby. For the independent traveller, finding one's way from the airport can be hair-raising, so it might be helpful if I mention that we found a company called Backpackers on the internet, which provides a vehicle and driver to the door of the hotel for 20 euros each way. We pre-booked with them, were met at the airport, and on the day of our return they were not just prompt but early to pick us up at the hotel. Altogether we were very satisfied, both with the hotel and this transport arrangement.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mohsen3848
Reviews.Content: great location and help ful staff the room was small but clean,very close to sight like blue mosque,hagia sophia and ... totally every thing was fine. just don't get the room in basement!!!value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Lea E
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a 4 star accommodation, the team is friendly and helpful, always ready to give information. Great location, close to most points of interest - within walking distance of blue mosque, hagia sophia, grand bazaaar, public transport and restaurants. The hotel provided free internet and the room had a great view to the city lights and sea. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and worst hotel I've ever been in my life”
Reviews.Author: windy66
Reviews.Content: Rooms extremely small, too much stairs; no elevator; not friendly for handicapped people. Morning breakfast below average and u get charged for omelette and juice!!! Reception Manager does not understand proper English and end up checking visitors out on wrong dates at the end of the day without giving u notice early in the morning. We had to search for a hotel at 7pm on a new year eve!!!! All what this stupid manager cared for was to sell us very expensive tickets on cruises to make his commission!! He could speak English then!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was fine for a city break”
Reviews.Author: ElleTait
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul for our mini-moon having flown in from our destination wedding in Kyrenia, Northern Cyprus. The hotel staff were friendly enough - but it was a little bit of a come down from five star luxury in Kyrenia, Northern Cyprus. The room at first glance looked tidy enough - I expected it to be a little more modern from the pictures, but the fixtures and fittings were a little work. We had a superior room and I had to check that it was because I was not convinced. What made it superior was the view. The pole that attached the pillows came away from the wall, and the pillows were frayed as well. Our bed was not made on our first night and there was an odd smell from the bathroom, until you ran the extractor for a while. It was fine for a stop over - but if this was not part of our package, I certainly would have been very annoyed to have had to pay the 350 euro's per night for the room (yes - they were quoting in euros for some reason).

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: MABAKIAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: The lobby was too small. our suite (207) was very small as well with 2 single beds and no place to put our suitecases. it is hardly a suite. we had no hot water on the first day of our stay. the bathroom is very tiny and so is the shower. The bathroom did not have enough lights on top of the mirror which made it difficult for me to shave and for my wife to put on her make up.Our room was facing the sea with some buildings the are burnt and rundown.another annoying thing which we were not aware of is the passing train which runs early morning till midnight.The aircondition did not work well and the hotel lent us a fan for the whole week we stayed with them and they did nother to fix it eventhough we reminded them twice.We were not impressed with the breakfast at all.The price that we paid was too high for such a room eventhough the location of the hotel is very good.the staff were kind and helpful and i give them full mark.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: John E
Reviews.Content: We had booked a sea view room through lastminute.com for a four night stay but on arrival were told none was available for that period. The "elegance" room was small but clean. But why charge extra for tea or coffee in the room to be made with tea bags or sachet. And there was no hot water for two days, unpleasant after being out all day in the heat. The staff were friendly and we felt sorry for them coping with the problems. Wouldn't recommend it. J and J England

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, but be aware more intimate than portrayed”
Reviews.Author: jacksonboulevard
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a very good website, which represents the rooms as somewhat bigger than they actually are. The staff, were discrete so much so that you hardly noticed them, not sure if that is a good or bad thing. The Hotels location is charming, cobbled streets - picture postcard perfect old town. Cute boutiques, restaurants and hotels away from the hustle and bustle of the centre ideal for a romantic getaway. However room was very small, although beautifully decorated â€“ I would recommend getting a room with a balcony to get a little more space! Breakfast was included but mediocre and seriously let down by charging for freshly squeezed orange juice, surely this is a breakfast staple as is tea and Coffee of a morning!? I think I would stay in the area again, but search out a similar hotel, with a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Real surprise how nice it was :)”
Reviews.Author: eph9
Reviews.Content: We stopped off in Istanbul for a weekend before heading to North Cyprus for a two week holiday. THe Avicenna Hotel was a real find, in a quieter road and tucked away with a beautiful front. Bit of a mix up when we arrived due which I think was caused by us having a 10 year old who we call a child and was on a third bed in one of our rooms but the hotel called her another adult (child seems to stop at 6 in Turkey?) and they tried to charge for another bed!! But we stuck firm to our booking which had been done through flight centre and we didn't pay. Our rooms were really nice, clean and nicely decorated. THe room with a view towards sea was nice. There is a train track behind hotel but it didn't bother us. Air con was a bit on/off and when I complained I was told all the rooms air con was not working properly and someone was coming the next day to fix it. Breakfast in hotel nice although different, but I like this and do not expect British food, that's why we travel, to try new things :) Dinner in top floor restaurant was also reasonably priced and very nice with views looking out to the sea and bay. Will definitely return to Istanbul and probably this hotel as it is very central to things.

Reviews.Title: “nice location otherwise horrible”
Reviews.Author: fati9
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to stay at avicenna when i arrived at the place.The surrounding was very pretty neat and peaceful.There were small cobbled streets with small hotels with traditional facades.There were flower pots n pigoens.The hotel itself was small and pretty too,i especially loved the breakfast area.However their were many short comings because of which i wont ever stay there again.Firstly the service was very slow.our checkin took more than an hour since room just got vacated n was getting cleaned,the feeders we asked to clean were i guess forgotten about.We asked for a baby crib,n after making us wait ,at the end of the day they simply said that the crib is broken.Other than that the room was fine but the wasroom was horribly tiny,i simply could not use it,it was like standing in a closet.The breakfast was just fine n juice was charged.Over all my experience was really bad ,the next day we moved into another hotel,not sure about the name i guess it was hotel Armada.It shared the same pretty area n was in sultanahmet...but had much better service.So to summarise i would say that the only good thing about avicenna is the location.r(sultahmet,blue mosque,tram r 3 min,so try to look for other hotels in the vicinity

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there”
Reviews.Author: Balabol
Reviews.Content: They made a double booking and offered us a much smaller room for the same price as the big one cost . We spent hours arguing and had to leave the hotel to find something else as no decent alternative was found.

Reviews.Title: “It has its attractions, particularly location but unprofessional extras would put me off staying there again”
Reviews.Author: ivan_benjamin
Reviews.Content: The main attraction of the Avisenna is the location, although the close proximity to the railway could be an annoyance to some people. Initially, sitting in the little patio garden waiting for our room to be made ready, we thought what have we let ourselves in for and how would we ever be able to sleep. But strangely, once in our room the occasional noise did not seem to bother us and we slept exceptionally well on a comfortable bed. We had , what they call, an 'elegance' room which is probably larger than the normal and fitted out a bit better (it had a red velvet chaise long which we couldn't actually make use of as we had to put our cases on it) and it had a balcony overlooking the Sea of Marmara which was worth while. I would mention that we were in room 205 which had a bathroom in which one could hardly turn around. The shower was a decent size once we were able to manoeuvre ourselves into it.The bathroom actually seemed as if it might have been a converted closet. the hotel has a certain faded charm about and internally was clean and well maintained. But the door to the balcony did not close fully and the exterior woodwork around the balcony door and windows was in very poor condition. The staff were very friendly and helpful but the main disappointments were the fact that while we understood the price included breakfast, we had to pay extra for eggs, for squeezed fruit juice and, of all things, tea bags if the Turkish tea was not to one's taste. And what's more we had to pay for the tea and coffee bags that were in the room which no hotel in the world would ever charge for. Something as petty and unprofessional as this would put me off returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshire_Yank
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were excited to stay in this traditional wooden Ottoman house that had been converted into a hotel. The hotel is ideally located in the heart of the old part of Istanbul and it is just a few minutes walk to the "Blue Mosque" and other sites. In addition, there a loads of restaurants and shops in the area. However, location is about all this hotel has going for it. The staff were rude and unhelpful. When we checked in, the young woman behind the desk acted as if our arrival was an inconvenience. The bell boy followed us everywhere and begged for a tip every time we left the hotel. The staff was unable to help us sort out the climate control in our room and were unable to help us print our boarding passes for our flight the next day. The breakfast was poor with mostly bread and a sparse selection of cheese and meat. Eggs and juice costs extra! Tea bags and coffee that were provided in the room also cost extra. The room was also noisy as a the railway runs right behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: greenfix
Reviews.Content: Superb location for short city break in Istanbul. Its based in Sultanahmet and in walking distance to all the major sight seeing spots. We stayed in an Elegance room, which had a balcony view of the Marmara Sea. The room was compact, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was tiny! Clean fresh towels and adequate toiletries. Breakfast was included. Buffet style and included tea, coffee, water. Fresh bread, pastries, jam, honey, yoghurt, cheese and cold meats. Also hot food, which included turkish fried potatoes, boiled eggs and fried meat. There was an extra charge for freshly squeezed juice. Unfortunately no fruit was available on the buffet. One thing to be aware of is that the tea and coffee supplied in the room is charged for as per mini bar prices. We thought this was odd as in general our experience is that tea/coffee in bedrooms is complimentary. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I could not recommend this place to anyone”
Reviews.Author: bluebudgie1
Reviews.Content: This bijou type small hotel is a conversion from a series of private houses but the alteration has been carried out with a lot of failure to follow detail and that seriously affects the amenity of the guest. There is no provision in the building for ramps or even handrails to help the handicapped. The stud walls between bedrooms are poor in terms of sound proofing. Altough the "elegance room" we were finally given was large enough to take two chairs only one was provided. The bathroom had a socket for a shaver which was not flush with the wall and potentially dangerous. Access to the bath was hindered by high plastic screens so that even the able bodied would have difficulty. The light source for the shaving mirror was placed behind the head so as to make it pointless. The floors are served by two elegant marble staircases which in the uk would be classed as a health and safety hazard in that there were no friction pads on the steps and more seriously the bannister for them was boken by alcoves so a slip on one of those steps would be serious and in this state impossible to use easily by the handicapped. There are no lifts. Initially when we reached the hotel although we had a superior room we were allocated the infamous narrow room on the ground floor near the railway. We had started to unpack by the time we realised this. There was no apology from the receptionist.I wonder how often it happens! The breakfast room is attractive but the outside patio is close by the railway line. I resent having to pay extra for fruit juice which is being sold at half the price outside in the street. The restaurant is to be avoided at all costs, and indeed patronage is poor. If you want to pay by plastic you have to go all the way down two floors to have your id checked at reception. My meal is best forgotton. A piece of solid ice butter on top of thinly layed schnitzel .As for the famed view accross the Bosporus the windows have not been cleaned for some time, not encouraging. Outside the balcony was cramped and dark and what diners there were came in. We overheard guests wanting to be allocated to other rooms once or twice,expressing irritation, wanting to see their new room before being moved. I think staff morale is low by virtue of the fact that they know they run a poor service.One the postive side the superficially attractive bedrooms are clean but have soft, squeaky beds which are not I am sure to the taste of all. The Hotel seems to run its own charging taxi service to the airport. I was told by our taxi driver that he had to be persistant because the staff told him that we had made other arrangments but obviously I cannot verify this. Not suited for anyone with walking problems, families and to my mind few others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel ruined by last minute demands for (unowed) money.”
Reviews.Author: claudmelpim
Reviews.Content: Was looking forward to posting 100% positve review - room lovely, situation excellent, staff apparently v. friendly. Breakfast nothing special and fresh juice and cooked eggs came at a supplement. But the real sting in the tail was the demand, as we were leaving (and shuttle bus was waiting), for money (about 11 euros) in payment for 3 tubes of Nescafe and 3 teabags off the, as I thought, complementary tray next to the kettle! We had decided to avoid the room mini-bar so as not to incur silly costs..but this demand was a complete shock. Furthermore, when I remonstrated the manager said it was clear we should pay.There was no notice/tariff in the room to alert us that these items were chargeable.When I explained I had no more Turkish lira he insisted I pay in euros.Because I was worried that the bus might be sent away without us I handed over euros, got some lira in change and reckoned later Id been cheated on this transaction too.How mean-spirited can a hotel get. Afraid it spoilt an otherwise good stay.Travellers beware.

Reviews.Title: “Best location & excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kottanattu
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms & good service. Courteous & helpful staff, especially Mr. Ulas at the reception desk & Mr. Ahmet, the Bellboy. Mr. Bahceli, the night receptionist helped us too with useful tips. We thank the staff for the memorable stay. We really recommend this hotel & staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & spacious rooms but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Amy
Reviews.Content: We chose Avicenna based on location - dead centre of Sultanamhet for around Â£90 per night is pretty reasonable. Rooms are big and beds are very comfortable. Buffet breakfast was adequate, though they do charge for some extras such as freshly squeezed juices and omelettes. Reception staff were all helpful and spoke good English. The only downside to the property is the railway line running alongside the road. This will of course affect all of the hotels on this street, of which there are many. However, if you request a room on the street side you can avoid this noise. I would have struggled to sleep if I had not had ear plugs with me.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you don't get an annexe room”
Reviews.Author: cjf186338
Reviews.Content: We were given a room in the annexe overlooking the railway track and only 5 metres from trains rushing past our window - from about 5.30am to midnight. The room was freezing and we spent most of the week requesting that the heating be turned on. I think they were trying to save money as I believe we were the only people staying in the annexe for most of that week. The front desk staff were generally surly and extremely unhelpful and have obviously not been trained to deal with complaints. The hotel is in a great location, very close to the Blue Mosque, and is probably OK if you're in the main building; however there are many other hotels in the area. If you do go there, just make sure you don't accept an annexe room.

Reviews.Title: “Rated Excellent on Last Visit, Slightly Disappointed This Time...”
Reviews.Author: Debs61023
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, perfectly situated and the staff helpful. We went here around 18 months ago and then ate the best food in the restaurant during all our time in Istanbul. So taking friends this time round, we had no hesitation in taking them this time round but we were disappointed with the quality of the food, extortionate price of the basic red wine and also breakfast choices. OK, but that's all. Hotel looking a bit tired this time, noticed the thin walls more this time round and staff seemed to be more 'appeasing' this time round rather than genuinly eager to please. Would return but more likely to try one of the other little boutique hotels close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel close to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: Anssi_11
Reviews.Content: Superb location, very friendly staff, very clean. Nice view over Bosphorus from the rooftop restaurant. Rooms a bit small, very little shelf space in the bathroom. Breakfast ok, but no juice except overpriced (3 â‚¬/glass) squeezed-to-order juice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay close to alle major attractions”
Reviews.Author: lemijalu
Reviews.Content: It was a lovely stay !! The staff made us feel very wellcome from the moment we arrived untill we left. Allways trying to help us and with a big smile. We were with a group of 14 people. With so many places to see and do the room was only for a very good and refreshing shower + sleep. The room was cleaned to perfection everyday. The location couldn't be better. Right in the middle of Sulthanamet area, not even 5 minutes walking to blue mosk,... but still a quiet street. Lots of options of restaurants and pubs around. Breakfast was also very good.:lots of cheese, and meat variety, breads and fruits.... very good. We would highly reccomend this hotel. Greetings from Ayse and her group.

Reviews.Title: “Not a particularly great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bernie076
Reviews.Content: Excellent position, major sights within walking distance. Staff were friendly enough when checking in. Walls very thin - we were kept awake by the activities of other guests!! Also, restaurant was hosting a private function on the one night that we did want to use it, and the noise was quite ridiculous. We called reception to ask when the party would be finishing since it was keeping us awake. We had to put up with extremely loud music and dancing right above our room until very late. On checking out, we were presented with a bill for cocktails which we had not had - an irony really, since on the one night we had hoped to use the bar we couldn't ! Our name was on the bill - not our writing, however - clearly written on by a member of staff who had got the wrong room number from another guest - no apology.

Reviews.Title: “a place to be back at ....”
Reviews.Author: kadtro
Reviews.Content: Great hospitality in a well organised and clean hotel. Good place for leisure among historic sights of Istanbul. trendy & design hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but”
Reviews.Author: LeeChadwick
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights end Jan 2011: airport-hotel pickup was OK with pleasant welcome from reception on arrival at the hotel. Our room was fine, well serviced and with balcony sea view and good quality bathroom/shower/linen etc - though out of 30 channels no English language TV. Perfectly adequate buffet breakfast, with optional extras. Our one dinner in the top floor restaurant was also OK. All the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The location is good, being very close to all the major sites. HOWEVER, watch out for extra room mini-bar charges. E.g.: a one-cup phial of Nescafe Â£2.40; a small can of peanuts Â£4.50 - very annoying indeed. Also, alcohol everywhere is very expensive: a bog-standard house wine in any one of the local eateries costs at least Â£20. Finally, the trams and buses are cheap and easy to use whilst complex one-way systems and closed off roads can make seemingly short taxi rides much longer than expected and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointing and frustrating experience.”
Reviews.Author: WideWorldTraveller6
Reviews.Content: I wish I could tell you what staying what staying at the Avicenna Hotel was like, unfortunately I canâ€™t, because despite having paid for in advance and confirming our booking, we were told upon our arrival that there were no rooms available. The flimsy excuse being, â€œthat they couldnâ€™t use all their rooms, as they were hosting a New Years Eve partyâ€�. Despite it being pointed out that they should have realised this when they were taking our booking and payment they were adamant that we could not stay there. We were left in the position on having to accept the only half hearted alternative on offer, which was to stay at a nearby older and inferior sister hotel and one free meal in the hotel restaurant. We were entranced by Istanbul and plan to pay a return visit, but we will definitely not be using the Avicenna Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was not a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: ja83
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with the hotel for the following reasons: - I was charged on my credit card 1 month prior to my arrival - 1 of 3 rooms we got didnt have air conditioning in the middle of summer. when we complained they gave us a fan. - They say wireless internet is available in the whole hotel but we couldnt get connection in our room - the hotel tried to charge us twice for hotel transfers I do not recommend any one to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, wonderful staff, pleasant stay...”
Reviews.Author: AnaPaula_Roger
Reviews.Content: Even if I am a little bit late, I just would like to share with you my experience on the Avicenna Hotel.... It was a lovely stay !! The staff made us fell very welcome since our taxi arrived until we left. Always trying to help us and with a big smile. Since the manager, till the staff from the breakfast service, all of them always very nice. We were a couple and 4 friends in two different rooms. 4 of us stayed in what I think was the biggest room in the hotel, very good. The other couple stayed in another room and yes, the room for 2 people it is a bit small, but if you come to Istanbul you don't want to stay in your room, do you ? With so many places to see and so many turkish coffee places, the room was only for a very good and refreshing shower + sleep. The room is cleanned to perfection everyday and air conditioner works fine. The location couldn't be better. Right in the middle of Sulthanamet area, not even 5 minutes walking to Hagia Sophia, but still a quiet street. Lots os options of restaurants and cafes around. Before I forget, the breakfast was veeeeery good. lots of cheese, and meat variety, breads and fruits.... very good. I would highly reccomend this hotel. P.S.: We were so pleased with our stay that before we left, we wrote on guest's book and we were amazed with all comments, seemed eveybody was very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience since last visit”
Reviews.Author: agapitosc
Reviews.Content: Since my last visit, my experience was very different. The room was many hours without heating, wc was blocked, phonecalls were made when not in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel very centrally situated for all sights”
Reviews.Author: Greenford-9
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with friendly helpful staff. My booking for 5 people was not initially as I had requested but they did everything to sort it out and we had a very comfortable and happy stay there. There is a railway line running at the back of the hotel so I believe that it is a bit noisy if your room is situated at the back !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice decor but room shockingly small, next to the railway track and the breakfast was lousy”
Reviews.Author: studiosix
Reviews.Content: Avicenna is in a good place and handy for the big sights, which you can walk to. The decor is lovely and staff helpful and friendly, but the 2 rooms we were allocated were tiny - the shower in our friends' room was literally smaller than in our caravan and if you had dropped the soap....... It was very noisy and we had fitful sleep - we were next to the railway track and a footpath which was used at all hours - and also the next door neighbours had a young child who screamed. We had paid a lot and were staying for 4 nights, but the hotel was packed on our first night, so no chance to move. There was no heating until I requested it - and then had to wait 2 hours for it to come on and the following evening again, no heating - in the absence of anywhere to sit we got into bed for warmth. We had to queue each morning to sit down to breakfast and it was like having breakfast at Paddington station it was so noisy. The food was absolute rubbish - cold cooked stuff, they charged for fresh juice, otherwise it was squash and the array of pastries looked good but were tasteless and hard. Never again....We have done many city breaks and this hotel must be the worst in terms of our experience of it. Sorry, it looks so nice too....

Reviews.Title: “Could have done better”
Reviews.Author: cindyhart
Reviews.Content: I am not impressed with this hotel. The sunny side with a view of the sea has a train going by.... The street side is very noisy also. The staff failed to tell us to set our clocks back. So sorry, we forgot, they said. The bed is too soft, we would move but we prepaid all 3 nights .

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: None0
Reviews.Content: Great location in Sulhanamet area. Close to major sites. Charming hotel. If you like request a room with a balcony out the rear part on a higher floor example room 206. You can view the marmara sea and the city lights. Yes there is some noise as you are in a large city and the train is below but nothing outrageous and we could sleep at night no problem. No significant noise from other rooms and the hotel had lots of guests. Other side of hotel has no balconies but looks on quieter street. Great beds, nice bathroom. Hotel has lovely spot at top floor for drinks and / or dinner which we highly recommend. We had a great meal. Breakfast was well done with option to eat on outdoor patio area. Reception staff helpful and pleasant and all service efficient. Also for rooftop restaurant in area try the Adamar hotel terrace restaurant. Excellent views and good food (not as delicious as meal we had at Avicenna we will note!).

Reviews.Title: “Charming and comfortable hotel in the heart of the old city”
Reviews.Author: mikedotgee
Reviews.Content: Spent five days at the Avicenna Hotel and really enjoyed our stay there. It was a small and friendly hotel, very clean with helpful staff and in the heart of the old city very near the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Be careful if you go on the tour of the city with Senkron Travel Agency though, as we booked this through the hotel and were very disappointed. It was not cheap and we felt we did not get what we paid for. We booked a coach tour which included the Grand Bazaar and were not informed when booking that, due to the holidays, many roads were blocked and the Grand Bazaar was closed, so it turned out to be a walking tour with one of the main attractions missing. We cancelled the afternoon part of the tour and were refunded some of the cost after some pressure from us, but not refunded the full amount. We loved Istanbul and would certainly use the Avicenna again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the heart of ancient Istanbul with very friendly staff members”
Reviews.Author: Thomas_Stopper
Reviews.Content: This hotel really lies in the heart of ancient Istanbul just a few minutes (5min) away from the blue mosque, Hagia Sophia and the palace. All staff members are very nice and always there to help with all kinds of questions. The only negative thing to say is the size of the bathrooms which are quite small but very clean. To ensure a nice and sound sleep ask specifically for a room next to the street. The other direction is too close to the railway tracks. All in all we really enjoyed our stay in this hotel and are already planning to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Terrific View and a Warm Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: musti2
Reviews.Content: In the mist of hotels Avicenna Hotel is an island of tranquility and peace. Located only 3 minutes from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia Mosque and the Top Kapi Museum it is worth to stay there by all means. Even though the trains is passing every couple of hours, the rooms are clean and quite. The view to the sea side is amazing from the upper level. The taste of the room interiors comes along with colors and style. I would go there again for sure and the management is flexible and professional. Of course you cannot expect the best English speaking personal, but this is a general issue of Turkey not only in Istanbul. The breakfast is okay and consists of Mediterranean food like butter, olives, eggs, tomatoes, cucumbers, green peppers, reÃ§el (jam/marmalade; a preserve of whole fruits) and honey. I think more than enough for an elegant city hotel. I would recommend this Hotel even for a stopover in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “August in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mabe_10
Reviews.Content: I have been very well; the services and hotel's staff were very nice

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH ITS PRICE, VERY BUT SERVICE AND NOT SERIOUS AT ALL”
Reviews.Author: Cris048
Reviews.Content: I am very sad with the bad attention given by Avicenna Hotel. I made the reservation 3 months before going, a double room, and chose the option of paying after my stay. 2 weeks before going they charged the whole amount of my stay, I contact them and they sent me their regrets and just offered me a 10% discount on one night dinner in their restaurant (ridiculous "present") When we arrived they gave us a single room with one extra bed, I asked for the double room I had booked and told me that next they day they would change my room (I realised it was something common in their hotel, because I wasn't the only person complaining about that) The day after they gave us a double room, number 110, it is right next to the air conditioning machine and it is impossible to rest at night. I asked them to stop it, and did it one hour later and after having asked for it 5 times (this happened the 3 nights we stayed in that room). As I had already payed my stay I couldn't even ask for a discount. In conclusion, very bad service, too crowded hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the Avicenna hotel take every step possible to ensure your stay in Istanbul will be absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: muelle1
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Avicenna hotel -- and in particular Bahceli Kitay who mans the front desk -- did everything possible to make our stay in Istanbul (our first) as pleasant as possible. Mr Kitay suggested sights and trips -- all his recommendations were right on target. The location of the hotel was excellent -- right in the heart of Sultanahmet and close to all historical attractions. The room was lovely and we had super view. The chambermaid responded to all our requests (additional towels, etc) immediately and with a smile and kept our room in tip top order. We would most certainly stay at the Avicenna hotel again and would recommend it highly to family and friends. Indeed, by the end of our four night stay, we felt as if we were leaving good friends behind. Just one example of the outstanding service at this hotel: on our final day in this wonderful city, we had to depart quite early (6 am) for the airport. The hotel restaurant does not open until 7 am for breakfast, so Mr. Kitay coordinated delicious sandwiches for us to take with us. Amazing! Warm greetings to all at Avicenna -- The Muellers from San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Looks good but it is not enough”
Reviews.Author: Vaevictix
Reviews.Content: At first sight this hotel and the room looked really good. However, there were many points to be improved to be at the expected level. Our room was one of the best in the hotel, but the air conditioned did not work properly (not enough cold), and some water was dripping on my head I had to move the bed for the night. There was a nasty smell in the bathroom, and its aerator was vibrating so much than one could feel like one was in an airplane taking off. This is a pity and hopefully it will be fixed, because the staff, the overall appearance of the hotel and its location are really good, and the breakfast was from far the best I had in Turkey. However, I consider the value was not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in great location but lacks the polish of a true 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tyronne1
Reviews.Content: I had to move rooms because air conditioner wasnt working properly. When I complained I was asked if I could just keep the window open! What a bad response! It was very hot! They eventually found me another room. Reception was obliging with maps and sights to see and with taxis. Gave my laundry in and porter wanted to count each item in the lobby including my underwear! He was stopped by reception. I was stopped from having a visitor to my room! Why? This is no problem for most 4 star hotels around the world! Breakfast service and food very good but pls provide low fat milk. Didnt enjoy seeing piles of dirty linen outside my door everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and professional atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: tolken
Reviews.Content: I was in charge of the reservation, we were five women in our thirties â€“ forties; I did it through the internet. So I had the possibility to get a good offer, but with no reimbursement. At first, I was scared, you never know...!, but nothing happened, I mean in a bad way. Firstly, the welcome was very kind. Secondly, both of our rooms were warmly and fully equipped; it is worthy to book one of the elegance rooms as I did because privacy is total. Finally, the room and restaurant services are professional and customers always get a kind feedback. The Avicenna Hotel is located in the old town, so you can easily be transferred to any area in Istanbul. To sum-up, next time I visit the city I will stay at Avicenna. Trust me and take your chance!, Liliana Valado FernÃ¡ndez Professor and freelance Translator&Interpreter at the University of Vigo, Spain

Reviews.Title: “top range”
Reviews.Author: soulat
Reviews.Content: It was a nice trip. Specially the hotel was centraly located rooms were nice Aircondition were top. We were two families we enjoied. alot the staff very much help full specially the Night manager and two helpers they were very nice polite and helpful. all the major things to see were near by means near by. visited 29/7/to 2/8/10 soulat choudry Birmingham uk

Reviews.Title: “Horrors!”
Reviews.Author: Lidia916
Reviews.Content: Naturally we ended up in the, by now, famous room three feet away from the railroad track! Lights in the bathroom were everywhere except where you needed one. The breakfast room was very pretty, but the breakfast only so-so. What good is fancy decoration if the train rumbles though every few minutes?? It was obvious that most people stuck in that room leave immediately, so at least they didn't make a fuss. There are lots of other hotels in the area which are much friendlier and NOT on the railroad line!

Reviews.Title: “nice place, very good situation”
Reviews.Author: lluis1966
Reviews.Content: outstanding situation istanbul. Incredibly, it is in town center but away from noisy areas.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: suemarieallen
Reviews.Content: The air conditioning was better than in most hotels and the breakfast was excellent. Staff were really helpful. We will certainly come back to the Avicenna

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, FRIENDLY HOTEL WITH GREAT LOCATION IN HISTORICAL AREA”
Reviews.Author: SetiTheFirst
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights, Reception was very friendly, professional and courteous and the young lady understood and spoke English well, room was not ready but we went to have lunch until they got the one-bedroom suite ready!!! Room is relatively small for studio not enough drawers to store your clothes but you can manage with what the room offers. We had 2 double beds stock together which was a little bet uncomfortable, nice balcony looking over some homes and at the end you can clearly see the Bosphorous Sea with all ships passing by and the main Island, very nice view day or night, but if you do not have a room with a view of the sea, you can always go to the roof restaurant and have a drink or just sit on the balcony looking at the magnificent view of the sea and some parts of Istanbul as well. The linens were always clean and changed daily, excellent decor some of the furniture pieces may need replacement. The wood floor needs some maintenance but very clean. The bathroom had a bathtub but the water was always coming through the tub to the floor of the bathroom, needs some sealant, the shower head refused to stay in-place, so would dangle and fall facing the wall and would have to hold it with one hand. I mentioned it to the front desk and promised to have some major maintenance done to all bathrooms very soon. Bathroom was generally very clean and full of all your bathroom needs every day, towels were nice and white, no stains ( you will be surprised in some brand name hotels what you can find). Finally, AC small but it works good after 30 minutes of operation, since your room key is electronic and you must insert it in its slot to connect the electricity, so you might need to ask for extra key if you need the AC on all the time. Medium Size LCD TV in room but few English Channels (BBC and EuroNews and some religious one), very boring TV system. The young lady at the front desk (Meenah) was very helpful and pleasant and made some great recommendations for visits and restaurants as well, so feel free to ask her about where to go, how to do it and when is the best time to visit. The rate included Bkfast and it is at the lower level cozy restaurant with Buffet style, some cheese, jams, cold-cuts, pastries, juices, one kinds of fruits, fresh made juices are 5 TL each and Omelets are 6.5 TL. The area is a bit small but fits most guests and very clean, there is an outdoor extension of the restaurant you can use if you smoke or like to be in the fresh air area, it is nicely done between the two parts of the hotel. Everything is dome was wood, floor, walls, and chairs and tables some are done with white leather coaches, best of all always very clean and enjoyable to eat there. The only draw back that we had to pay for the transportation from and to the airport (30 Euro each way). Most of the sights are walking distance, Sultanahmet Square, the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia Museum, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, The Obelisk, Hippodrome, and Arstar Bazar as well many many restaurants, cafes and Pups that fit all budgets. Supermarkets are also everywhere if you feel like picking up a snack or some drinks on the go for few Liras. In sum, I would definitely go back to the area and stay at the Avicenna hotel because I felt as being at home with friendly staff, clean place, convenient location and excellent view from room 202, and even the guests are great to converse with.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Elegance Suite!”
Reviews.Author: NikNakN00
Reviews.Content: Things didn't start well with this hotel, on arrival we were told that they had overbooked and that our double room was unavailable. They tried to put us in two other rooms, both small and dingy with two single beds. After turning these down they managed to find a larger room with single beds pushed together which we (reluctantly) accepted. We were quite surprised to find after looking out of the drawn curtains that we were next to a derelict house on one side and the other a train track- about 2 metres from the bedroom window! They upgraded us to the Elegance Suite on the second night though and it was much nicer- despite still being able to hear the trains passing in the night. Although quite overpriced, based off of the rates at the front desk, I would not stay at this hotel in a standard room. Aside from the problems with the room, its a reasonable hotel, good breakfast, good location for sightseeing, friendly bar staff and good view from the bar upstairs (aside from the train tracks and frequent trains!!). I do feel you could probably stay at a nicer hotel for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sophielawrence0036
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was really good. The staff were friendly and always willing to help. I had a standard room which was lovely with traditional ottoman style furnishings. It was also cleaned everyday so I always had clean sheets and towels. It had a nice restaurant with a terrace which had lovely views of the bosphorous. The breakfast room was beautiful and the food was excellent. The best thing about this hotel was the location, it is just two minutes walk away from the Hagia Sofia and the blue mosque and about 5 minutes walk from Topkapi Palace. I would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking about coming to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: cloeodm
Reviews.Content: - Close to the blue mosque and Santa Sofia - The staff is friendly - They don't change the breakfast menu, so after a while you get bored of the food. - Rooms are too small and the air-conditioning is too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, friendly, charming place that you wouldnt want to leave”
Reviews.Author: mehdi80
Reviews.Content: I have to say, having read some of the reviews, I had my reservations when I arrived at the door. However, some of them were quickly erased after the taxi dropped us on the cobble-stone street right outside the hotel, full of little laid-back restaurants. The reception was amazingly friendly, and over-eager to welcome us. The hotel is very charming, and looks beautifull, the rooms are very comfortable although not luxury. The breakfast was good, served in a charming garden area inside the hotel. The location is superb and faultless... its a 5 min walk from all the sites you want to see. Ok, there is a train that runs behind thel hotel. Our room was on the track-side, but, seriously, if you cant sleep with the little noise that comes from the trains, my guess is that you dont live in a very lively city. We loved it, from A to Z. Its not luxury, its just charming, friendly and comfortable. AND, it has air conditioning (we came from Prague where most hotels didnt!).

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was very good value and in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: jcn_10
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect - very close to the Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque, lots of restaurants and shopping around. The room was small, but clean and air-conditioned and the bathroom was very nice. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good and the courtyard was a lovely place to eat. The floor in our room was quite warped, which was a bit awkward for walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, bad stay”
Reviews.Author: mwidmann
Reviews.Content: The room we got was really small and faced the railway, which passed about 10m in front of our room window every 30 minutes or so. A room change was not possible as the hotel was booked out. The first thing after the check-in was a sales presentation of various travel products the hotel or the receptionists must get a share on. The water ist not drinkable, a bottle of water from the minibar very expensive (1,5tl). Breakfast was ok, with a good assortment of foods. If you're going to stay here go for the more expensive superior rooms. But do it only if you must. I sincerely can't recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in old town Istanbul, great service, so-so accomodations”
Reviews.Author: zdoctorsin
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were all excellent and the location of this hotel in Sultanahmet was good. But the AC was out for 3 of 5 days, the breakfast was only "okay" compared to other hotels in this category, the room was pretty tiny (for the price we'd expected better!) and our ocean view was basically a tiny sliver of blue! Also - the cleaner used for the floors (?) was super stinky and made walking down the halls unpleasant at times.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel wonderfully situated near the historical town”
Reviews.Author: Benoitlux
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice with view on the sea. The staff of the hotel was very kind ans helpfull. The hotel is very well siuated between the sea and the historical town. There is a train line passing nearby but teh noise is very limited. The bathroom was very small and did not look 100% clean according to our standards.

Reviews.Title: “perfect extended weekend at avicenna”
Reviews.Author: Julian_Warsaw
Reviews.Content: we've planned our trip just 7 days before flying out and had quite little expectations. we just wanted to relax and spend several days away from home. It turned out to be one of the best trips we've had recently. Istambul is a must see!! Avicenna is at a perfect location, value for money is really decent and service is great! Much of our opinion about the city and the hotel is due to meeting a great waiter from the hotel restaurant ( Muharrem). really helpful and took every our request as a priority! it was the best service person we've ever met - giving you a nice close relationship but also not crossing a line of trying to become your friend too much. and the guy has been at the plase for the last 10+ years so you'll meet him there for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location”
Reviews.Author: Tom-Tockenham
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice hotel, pleasant stay. We liked the city and the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: suesteward1
Reviews.Content: My Sister and I travelled to Istanbul in April 2010 and stayed at the Avicenna. The hotel exceeded all our expectations despite the small mix-up with our room on the first night. The room we had was lovely, not huge, but then it didn't need to be - it had a fantastic view from the balcony and was absolutely spotless. The staff were absolutely amazing - so helpful - particularly the girl on the Reception desk. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet my expectation but it was ok”
Reviews.Author: oriames
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small. The TV has almost no non-Turkish channels, but then who watches TV during vacations? The rooms are not so big but sufficient. I took a promotional booking anyway so I should have expected it. Good location for Sultanahmet. All in all it was sufficient. Quaint and cute hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nicee”
Reviews.Author: resdre
Reviews.Content: great hotel staff very helpful to us is very good too, especially thanks to all of serkan comments tenky serkan..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and service”
Reviews.Author: Holmsik
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room, good service and restoran as well as breakfast. Only negative aspect I have noticed is the absence of Eurosport channels at TV.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel but take care about...”
Reviews.Author: giancarlocrespi
Reviews.Content: The service was good, also the breakfast was ok, just and advice....never ask for a restaurant to the portier. We did with the girl and she send to "a friend of her", with also a presentation paper write from herself to the owner of the restaurant. Well WE PAYED 4 TIMES THE PRICE IN ITALY!!!! It was stunning! Take care about asking those kind of information, you're gona pay a lot. The last day I got drunked, ok I was stupid, me and my friend (he doesnt' drink) travelled back to the hotel with a taxi. The taxi driver found my wallet but to get it back he wanted 50 euro!!! I was drunked and my friend is a shy guy, so, he stoled my money!!! My friend screamed for help, we were in front of the hotel, 1 meter from the door and the recepition is one meter from it, but they didn't hear anything.... The day after, when I told them about what happened they told me to give them the I.D. code of the taxi I got before it leaved, so they could call the police and solve all. I'm still waiting an answer. What say? I'm really disappointed from the service of the portiers!!!! About the hotel it is really nice, direct in the center, the rooms are clean and confortable. So, go there, it's nice, just use it only for sleeping and take care when you ask some advice to the portiers....;-)

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls spoils an otherwise good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThreeKingsLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location for seeing the major sights in Istanbul (but not the best for evening entertainment). Don't expect to recover after a day of full activities as whoever renovated the building did not consider how easily sound travels - we could literally hear everything (i.e. word for word conversations) from the room next door. We had the same issue in two rooms: one at the back near the railway and then, once we had been moved to get away from noisy trains, in the executive rooms in the main building. Shame because otherwise this is a great little hotel that is perfect for ticking off the sights of Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “The brochure is great but the reality is quite different...”
Reviews.Author: koala007
Reviews.Content: We are not very happy with the organization of the hotel, the hotel seemed to be overbooked and the reception sent us another hotel nearby. The driver did not show up for the transfert from the hotel to the airport and he was also late for the transfert from the airport to the hotel. Nobody seemed to care about anything !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: silios
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels around.Stayed for 2 nights and loved it. The staff is excellent and the hotel is very very well decorated. Romantic place with superb interior - exterior ,recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: holidaysabroad
Reviews.Content: A pleasant good value for money hotel in a superb location very close to the main istanbul attractions but in a quiet area. Upper rooms at the back have a great view over the Bosphorus and the nearby railway is not really a problem as night trains are very infrequent. Restaurant food was very good and reasonably priced but very few guests seemed to use it

Reviews.Title: “Tiny uncomfortable room”
Reviews.Author: MACSussex
Reviews.Content: The Avicenna Hotel is well placed with many of Istanbul's places of interest within walking distance and a good choice of shops and restaurants in the vicinity. Friendly reception rather mared by Gulsah pressing us to buy tickets for the Saturday night dinner with belly dancer for Â£60 each. Our rooms were on the lower floor of the rear block, two singles were of reasonable size with uninterupted view of the railway. However the room that I was allocated was TINY, the windows faced directly onto the garden/breakfast terrace therefore the blinds had to be kept down. This public area and my room was lit throughout the night by lamps close to the bedroom windows.The wardrobe was unusable by me because the ceiling height rail was out of reach. Promises of a move to another room after the first night were not honoured. Room 219 is not acceptable for any paying guest.

Reviews.Title: “romantic weekend............go here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshirePolarbears
Reviews.Content: fabulously friendly helpful staff who couldn't do enough for us. well decorated rooms (although could do with a little more wardrobe space if being picky!!)! breakfast was great. plenty of choice. hotel spotlessly clean. perfectly situated for sightseeing and bars and restaurants. we had the best weekend ever and would definetly go again. The most romantic place to be in love . perfect xx

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with kind staff, clean and cosmopolitan rooms and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: yusintil
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Avicenna hotel. In the heart of Sultanahmet and just in a walking distance of the Blue Mosq, Aya Sophia and other landmarks. Staff was great, relaxed and very helpful. Rooms an towells were cleaned on a daily basis. Breakfast was more than satisfying. Looks are modern and a great vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value, clean and tastefully furnished”
Reviews.Author: Kentsub
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a very pleasant stay at this hotel. Great location in a quiet street only a few minutes walk from all the main tourist sites and a range of restaurants and bars. The staff were all welcoming and friendly (although they were a bit too keen to promote some of the tours!). They actively seek feedback about how to improve the hotel which is always a good sign. The standard rooms are on the small side including a bathroom which is tiny but they are spotlessly clean and tastefully furnished with all the necessary facilities (TV, fridge, safe etc). Quite a good selection at breakfast but don't expect too much of the cooked food or much in the way of fresh fruit (but they will squeeze fresh juice for a bit extra). These are only minor grumbles though. For the price of the room (just over Â£50 for a double including breakfast) it was great value and the central location makes it easy to pop back during the day if you want to take a break.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: PANKVAS
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in great location. Clean, quiet with very courteous staff ready to satisfy all our wishes. The price comperated to the benefits was excellent. We will come back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, clean and good service”
Reviews.Author: CriMaria
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located closed to the nicest monuments of the city, few minutes walking distance, Hotel staff is friendly and helpful, and rooms are warm and clean (maybe beds a little bit short!).

Reviews.Title: “A place I look forward to returning to”
Reviews.Author: Suzi777
Reviews.Content: I was very welcomed by the staff. A lovely environment---good lighting in the entire hotel....the room felt very modern and well appointed. More for my money than other places where I stayed. Nice to have wi fi in the room which always worked. One of the best breakfast offerings in all my travels in Turkey. Such an oasis at the end of the day. Wish it were a little closer to the Grand Bazarre. Trip advisor rates were excellent compared to the "desk price" which I never would or could have paid. Sahra was amazing as the guest relations REP. All front desk personel were extraordinarily lovely and friendly. It felt like I was leaving family when I departed the hotel. In fact I don't feel that bonded when I am WITH my own family!!! :-) Whenever I think back on my stay at Avicenna, I am feeling eager to return.

Reviews.Title: “At the heart of Istanbul, but still very calm and peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: crocodile10
Reviews.Content: An hotel is in central location within walking distance. Staff very friendly and relevant.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lisaleeLondon
Reviews.Content: we had a wonder time in istanbul. the hotel and staff are adoreble and very helpful indeed. The rooms may not be large but are clean and very well presented. The girls at reception mine and gulsah were very helpful and welcoming and made our stay an unforgettable one, they delt with all our arrangments, tours dÄ±nner reservations and dance shows (turkish nights is a must see. thank you once again.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of class”
Reviews.Author: FilipAntwerp_Belgium
Reviews.Content: Tastefully decorated and organized hotel. Centrally located, with friendly and helpful staff, delicious breakfast and adequate room service. The rooms seem a bit tiny but quite stylish

Reviews.Title: “Great location,well appointed if small rooms, generous breakfast, helpful and polite staff.”
Reviews.Author: raymondmaw
Reviews.Content: In a quiet street near the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia, Hotel Avicenna is located in a traditional Ottoman style house. Perfectly placed for seeing the main sights of Istanbul it offers well appointed rooms, good breakfasts and helpful and polite staff. We stayed for four nights and would happily have stayed longer. The hotel was most helpful about posting our house keys we left in the bedroom back to us.

Reviews.Title: “our staying in this hotel was really excellent.TeÅŸekkÃ¼rler!!!”
Reviews.Author: InnaSPB_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel we really liked, courteous staff, clean rooms, nice interior, very convenient location. We were very pleased and will definitely come again! Russia, Saint-Petersburg

Reviews.Title: “The nightmare...”
Reviews.Author: laylap
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, people are, IN GENERAL, very kind. But we had REALLY bad experiences over there: the price of our laundry changed 3 TIMES at the same day................................................And when you asked for a receive, the guy of the reception ( a sir, 50 years old, something like this, with moustache) was SOOOOOOOOOOOOO ofended. We were in heneymoon, I remind you.... We did`t want problems, you can imagine. But, i mean, we are not stupid, you can have an idea of the situation. The english girl who sells tours, GULSAH DURMUS , sold us a [--] TOUR (WITH SLAVERY INCLUDED), which costed us 60 euros each, was , at LEAST, EMBARRASSING!!!!!! We even recorded "the best part" of the tour (it was Bosphorus Tour): a ridiculous leather fashion show, with fake models, etc. etc.! ItÂ´s better to stop here... this makes me so embarassed. the old man who took us to Bosphorus (very unpolite, and he didn`t know how to speak english - worst, worst, than me - as you can see, i donÂ´t know that much) - everybody was, i mean, almost sleeping, as well). When we complained and asked for a transfer (last day), the guy i think is the manager of the hotel (well dressed, and everything), came into the "taxi" - a black car, no identification, with a sir driving, so: me, my husband, and both guys in the front, speaking turkish, a little nervous. It was so scary, we thought we were going to be killed. Everything was so strange in that car, we even called to my husbandÂ´s brother, who lives is london, to tell him the situation in english, so we wanted that they knew there were people aware of where we were going (we ASKED the airport, but who knows...). Thanks god we are back, safe, to tell you what we passed through.

Reviews.Title: “A vey classy hotel in the old town...”
Reviews.Author: asarangi
Reviews.Content: A vey classy hotel in the old town. Perfect location for all the site seeing. Walking distance to all. Guest relations manager Gulsah and Mine' make you very comfortable. When you arrive you are given all the info about the hotel as well as site seeing, very Nice Touch. Definitely the place toi stay in Istanbul-a jewel in the crown!!

Reviews.Title: “To Istanbul - Sultanahmet ? Go to Avicenna Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThugBoy55
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 days in this hotel. I was the first time in istanbul. when I went inside the hotel, I saw that I am at the right place. Then Ahmet at the reception with a smile .. I felt at home .. The room was perfect .. Hotel is located in Sultanahmet. You could be anywhere by foot or by tram or metro. Staff of the hotel were really friendly, they love to help .. I would like to thank them. So if you go to Istanbul - Sultanahmet goes .. I recommend to everybody in the Avicenna Hotel to stay ..Tolga

Reviews.Title: “Maybe good for backpackers, but not for those needing service”
Reviews.Author: WorldCitizenJeff
Reviews.Content: When you travel on business, you cannot show up at the customer unshaven and smelling from a transatlantic flight. What can I say? Hotels, at a bare minimum, must provide a bed at night and water in the morning. When there is no water in the morning, you're getting 50% of the deal that you paid 100% for. When the staff then do nothing to compensate you, at least you can be glad for the competition. There are a few great places within 100m of this hotel - stay at any of those. Note: This is the third and last time I stayed at the Avicenna. I had similar problems in Sept and Nov 2009, but I put it down each time to extraordinary circumstances. I then came back twice because the rate was great. Never again. (One small positive note: The (poor) barman - who was also the guy delivering room service and the only waiter - did a great job with our dinner.)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: DubaiDee
Reviews.Content: Its a very cute little hotel. I'm used to big names and 5 star hotels so i went there assuming that i would be dissapointed but it was great! Rooms were very clean, staff were friendly and helpful, they gave us really good tips on how to get around the city. Its location is perfect if you like site sighting because its right between most of the sites. Its in the old touristic part of Istnabul so restuarants are alot more expensive than other places in the city. Tip: Ask teh hotel to book you a cab because if you take one from the streets he will most definitely rip you off.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey042
Reviews.Content: The Avicenna Hotel was exactly what I needed when I travelled to Istanbul last December. The staff were extremely helpful, the rooms were clean and quiet, breakfast was great, and overall it was excellent value! Istanbul is a wonderful place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: AliciaC1
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms, not clean rooms, no lift, poor breakfast, not all staff speak english although very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “To say that this hotel is 4-star is a bit of a stretch”
Reviews.Author: SydneyHenry
Reviews.Content: Dear traveller, The Concierge was unwilling to comply quite adamantly with the conditions of my reservation made over the internet on Bookings.com, namely, the free transfer to Ataturk Airport without any supporting evidence until higher management was sort. In addition, it was also quite surprising that the hotel was unwilling to arrange alternative transport from the hotel back to the airport other than their standard high fare by private car, for example, shuttle bus. The Manager of the Hotel appeared rather rude in my discussions of alternate transport from the hotel back to the airport and rather vague and unhelpful and told me to, "go up the street and try to find an agency who books shuttle buses". These findings make it so intriguing as to why this hotel has a 4-star rating. Further concerns about the hotel include lack of elevators, which is tiring if your room is on the 3rd floor, relentless persuasion to eat at the Hotel restaurant which is quite expensive and quite frankly has crickets for music, not to mention the barging in of hotel staff into our room before the last of my company were to leave the room, in order to debate which staff member attains ownership of goods left by guests at the hotel. I found the overall professionalism of the hotel staff through all levels to be disappointing at best. I guess my only advice to future travellers is to be vigilant of guest reviews and to choose accommodation carefully.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis in the old part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Fibie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Avicenna is located close to the main attractions in Sultanahmet. The staff is friendly and very helpful.The rooms are a bit small, but clean. Wonderful breakfast! All you need for stay in Istabul if your main target is the old town and the attractions located there.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HARD WORKER STAFF”
Reviews.Author: loverSemi
Reviews.Content: we stayed this hotel 5 days and it was perfect. all staff are very polite kindly and they work really hard. they always give us recomendation and advices especially mine and sahra very helpfull and friendly thanks all of you. we ate 2 nights in restaurant it has a panaromic view you couldt find better view in istanbul you can stay all holl night near the window. Thank you very much avicenna Ä± will come back again

Reviews.Title: “Great sea view, great location, great service, great food !”
Reviews.Author: puksielady
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in the Avicenna hotel. We had a great experience ! Our room was on the second floor and had sea view. I would highly recommend this room. We hardly heard the train. The people in the hotel were very friendly and very helpfull. When arrived we ordered a small thing to eat on the rooftop terrace (again great view !). The food was excellent ! The first drink was offered for 1 euro ! The location of the hotel is perfect: very close to the blue mosque, but very quiet. We loved our stay here, and recommend this hotel to everyone !

Reviews.Title: “Poor rooms plus poor location = very poor sleep along with unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Abelatif
Reviews.Content: The room - very poor rooms, our first night was on the ground floor level. The room was tiny (as were most of the rooms), the room looked good, bed was very old/broken mattresss, the bathroom was ok. The room was next to the road, constant noise in the night. Serious lack of noise insulation in the hotel. Changed room after 1 night (the first night reception refused to change saying there were no rooms available - blatant lie as the hotel was pretty empty). The second and third nights were spent in a room at the back of the hotel, this was bigger but the trainline is so close its crazy. Again the bed was horrendous. On the last night, the lock in the bathroom broke and locked in my wife - although the staff member was very helpful in breaking the lock. I have stayed in many hotels around th world and this was NO BOUTIQUE - it was a clear very pricey 3*. The staff - mixed bunch. Night receptionist was very smug and not very helpful (wouldn't inform us that our driver had arrived to take us the airport!). He also was totally blase on our arrival at about 12am, with no offer of tea a drink or any other welcome gesture). The day receptions were better. The concierge has no idea about her role. She has not eaten at any restaurants she recommends etc....very useless. Breakfast - So amusing. There is hardly anything to eat but bisuits, some cold meat and coffee.... Restaurant - did not eat but ordered room service, the food was very good. Try not to stay at this hotel if you can...I would not use again and would suggest you try somewhere else. No idea why people would rate this place/

Reviews.Title: “LIKE HEAVEN”
Reviews.Author: triperMoscow
Reviews.Content: this hotel is like heaven. kindly staff delicious meals cleaan rooms and wonderful location. everyyear i will go one or two times this hotel. I hope to see every staff again. especially you must see SIPSI RESTOURANT at roof. It has a perfect panaromic view. Ä± recommed all of you this wonderful hotel

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: survivorbudapest
Reviews.Content: When we were think about a good holiday we saw avicenna and we read all rewievs and decided to come here. avicenna was perfect all staff try to make us happy and feel like home. breakfast was perfect you can find lots of thing for eating. for lunch we went to the restourant on the roof. meals was really tastely and also for dinner we ate at the roof every night. i hope we will come back again avicenna. If you want to feel like a star, you must go to th Avicenna hotel. AND MANY THANKS FOR ALL LOVELY,FRIENDLY AND KIND STAFF WE HOPE TO SEE YOU AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “Avicenna Hotel - A Gem of a hotel, we will return”
Reviews.Author: Deb61
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have just returned from a 3 night break at this little gem of a hotel 2 minutes walk from the Blue Mosaqe. The staff were friendly, rooms spotless and we could not fault the food. We ate in 2 nights of the 3 in the hotel restaurant (didn't intend to but we were so tired the first night we stayed in, but then just had to return on our last night too as it was such good value). We had a super 4 course set menu for around 20 Euros a head. Even a bottle of the Doluca red wine was very well priced at 25TL, no other restaurant in Turkey has ever beaten that price for us. Being two women on our own in Istanbul was a bit daunting at first (despite being 40+) and on the first night we did have to cope with a bit of hassle. By the first daytime though , the locals in the bars and restaurants around the immediate area of the hotel (and even further up by the mosque) got to know our faces. We enjoyed the banter with them and had a feeling very soon that a lot of it was in fun, even feeling we were being looked out for. We will return one day and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Avicenna Hotel is a wonderful and familiar hotel”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulFan77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so wonderful. It is really familiar, the personal is so friendly, the rooms are nice and the whole hotel is the best for a nice stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sasha_kg
