Reviews.Content: Avicenna is a lovely small boutique hotel with very well designed rooms and great attention to detail. This trip was to celebrate our anniversary and we found a fruit basket and wine in our room upon arrival, which was a very nice touch. The room had beautiful views and a good size balcony. All the staff were very welcoming and always extremely polite. The food in the hotel was lovely both for breakfast and dinner. The location is also brilliant for all the sightseeing and close to the Blue Mosque and Agia Sophia. All in all we had a wonderful time and would like to say a huge thank you to all the staff, especially Sahra at the guest relations who arranged everything for us. Hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “A really enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: Tourist072
Reviews.Content: We had such friendly and personal service at this charming hotel. Our room was spotlessly clean, with attractive and elegant decor. The location was perfect for discovering all of the wonderful historic sites of Istanbul, just minutes walking from the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace etc. and the trams and ferries to other areas were just a few minutes beyond them, in spite of the fact that the hotel is in a quiet area of the city. Breakfast, which was plentiful and varied, is served in a charming room and the bar and restaurant at the top of the hotel looked out over the Marmara Sea. It may be that the room was just a little short on storage space but this issue was far outweighed by the excellent and friendly staff, their helpfulness with any query, they even rang Germany for us, and the excellent location. We did have a great time there and would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great People, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelergirlBoston
Reviews.Content: I am strating a project on ottomam history for my masters degree and I decided to take a trip to the old capital of the ottoman empire this september. i did not want to stay at one of those large hotels and away from the main hoistorical sites... When I located Avicenna Hotel I was intriged even by the name..... Avicenna is named after a great teacher "Ibni Sina" who is the founder of medicine, among many traits... Anyways back to the hotel, it provded to be a great choice... Location above all was great, steps away everything I needed to see, Tokapi palace, the museums and all. Staff were great and very helpful. I was able to sit at the terrace or the garden and review the days findings and get feedback and help from the hotel staff.....Food was great, my room did not have the coean view but rather the main street and saint sofia, but that was great, imagine sleeping under the shadow of saint sofia every evening.... next time when i ahve ore money I will be staying on the see side so i can see the maiden tower.... :-) Rooms were decorated in the older ottoman flair but with all modern appliances... there were plazma TVs, great clean beds, bathrooms.... perfect lace to find yourself or get lost.... I woudl definetly recommend it... Don't miss this gem....

Reviews.Title: “It was like home away from home”
Reviews.Author: travelergirlBoston
Reviews.Content: This is such a quaint, cozy, beatiful hotel i can not explain.... We were not sure at first staying at this hotel, it looked charming from the pictures and the virtual tours, and let me tell you they were all true... We stayed at the honeymoon suite, since it was our anniversary. Beautiful room, with great views of the marmara see and the maiden Tower....The hotel was exteremly clean, well decorated, staff was great and very friendly... It was steps away from all the historical attractions, only 5 minutes to blue Mosque and Saint Sofia.... And yu can take the trolley to grand bazar within minutes... On tiop of everythign else, this little hotel has a great terrace/bar and a restaurant where you can eat great food across the marmara sea and even see the dolphins pass true..... We are definetly going back..... You shoudl try this place.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, dream view, right in the middle of history.”
Reviews.Author: YamaLittleton
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Avicenna after 14 years. Recent renovations in the rooms and restaurants have made a significant change. It is a walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar, and only a short metro ride away from the modern centers of Istanbul. The panoramic view of Bosphorus and Marmara Sea from the restaurant makes it worthwhile to have a few meals there.

Reviews.Title: “what a perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweety013
Reviews.Content: Ä± and my boyfriend stayed this hotel. Some our friend recomend us to this hotel. we lived perfect holiday. everything was perfect. Breakfast was really good. they have tastely foods and very good garden for smoking. we had our dinner two times at the restaurant it had really good bosphours view. And also Ä± would love to say thank you for all staff. all of them really friendly and polite. Ä± always recomend this hotel everybody. and i will go again at christmas.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a good night's sleep don't go near this place.”
Reviews.Author: timayWiltshire
Reviews.Content: If you want a good night's sleep, don't go near this place. The hotel was refurbished two years ago, and some idiot decided to mount the televisions on the wall adjoining the next door room. Not only that, but the televisions in the two rooms are mounted back to back on the same wall. If someone in the next room switches on their television, you can hear every word. We stayed for 5 nights. On night 3, our neighbours TV was switched on at midnight and stayed on, despite our hammering on the wall till 1:30 am. The following night the same thing happened. At 2:30 am we contacted the desk who tried ringing the occupant and knocking on the door, but because the TV was so loud the occupant couldn't hear his attempts. We complained at 8:00 to be told that it would be sorted. When we came back at 6:00 pm nothing whatsoever had been done. Eventually the staff contacted the occupant and asked her to turn it down after midnight! True to form it blared out that night from 11:00 pm till 12:05 am. In all we complained to five members of staff, all of whom did nothing. If you're deaf, it's the place for you. Otherwise stay clear!

Reviews.Title: “My room was noisy - avoid it!”
Reviews.Author: Rodney017
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel except for room 4B - avoid this one like the plague. They really shouldn't charge for people to sleep in a room like this. The sound of dripping water all night from some hydraulic system (like a water torture); every toilet flush on that side of the hotel ran through a soil pipe behind a wall in the room; periodically, in a locked cupboard, an oil-fired burner ran, making the walls of the room shudder and emit a very loud low rumble. Impossible to sleep. The trains outside the back window were mild in comparison. Poor value for money if you were in that room!

Reviews.Title: “perfect sultanahmet location”
Reviews.Author: Dommtl
Reviews.Content: nice small hotel; rooms with character and very clean. Ask for a room on the top floor, all (i think!) with balcony with a view of blue mosque or bosphorus. Maybe not huge for north american standards but large enough for 2 anyways.. . We stayed on the blue mosque side, probably quieter since other side there is a train track running close to the building... very close to all historical attractions and restaurants. nice complete breakfast in the garden; nice balcony on roof terrasse overlooking bosphorus perfect for sunset cocktail and/or dinner. friendly staff and free wifi in room...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, amazing location, Tastefully decorated”
Reviews.Author: DrTubbs
Reviews.Content: Me, My wife and my parents in law went to Istanbul for a 7 day holiday. We recieved excellent service at all times from the staff at the Avicenna, especially Oyku in Guest Relations. Everything from the rooms to the restaurant oozed class in this Boutique Hotel. The location of the hotel is brilliant, so close to all the major sites whilst also great value for money. The only small flaw with the hotel is the size of the rooms and the storage space for clothes. I am sure it would be fine for a weekend visit with reduced luggage but with 2 peoples clothes and shoes for one week our room resembled a chinese laundry with clothes hung up on every available surface!! However, rather than end on a bad note..to summarise Amazing staff, amazing location, tastefully decorated

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FLAGDOG
Reviews.Content: Situated very close to the main attractions of the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul eg Blue Mosque, Aghaia Sofia, Topkapi palace - yet also in a very quiet street . We visited coincidentally at the end of the Ramadan period when this area of the city was "alive" particularly during the evenings however the area around the hotel wads unaffected by the crowds and traffic congestion. Meals in the hotel were excellent as was the service generally.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rhiannon51
Reviews.Content: My friend and I found the Avicenna a great hotel in a quiet and central position to explore Istanbul. Good choice of restaurants and shops all around. The room, though standard, was a good size, nicely decorated and really clean. The inner garden was great to have breakfast in as well as sit and read following a days sightseeing. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: gwynfa
Reviews.Content: The Avicenna is a pretty hotel in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, tucked away up a cobbled street yet within easy walking distance of the major tourist attractions. Yes our room was small, with a tiny bathroom, but it was clean, comfortable and quiet so we had no complaints. The buffet style breakfast was delicious. We didn't visit the hotel restaurant because there are plenty of very nice tavernas just around the corner in an area that has a relaxed and friendly atmosphere. With so many wonders to explore right on the doorstep, this nice little hotel provides an excellent base.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Sevdens
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in istanbul in september. we get a nice bedroom with a little terrasse view on the Blue mosquee which was great Hotel was really clean, staff so friendly, really good location, in the center of sultanamet,, 5 MN walking from ste sophie or the bue mosquee Breakfast was very good also. We really would like to recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: DarrellM77
Reviews.Content: Such a mixed bag for this hotel. First the bad stiff. We were put into room B04. This was a single room with the bed turned sideways and a collapsable camp bed laid alongside. When I complained that we had booked a double room I was informed that this really was a double but that a new room could be made available the following day. 1 hour later when talking about the problem with friends in the lobby and our steps to complain to Jules Verne, the travel company, miraculously a new bedroom was offered. The second bed room was room 115 which as you'll realise from the other reviews is 5 metres from a railway line which runs from 5.45am till gone midnight. Good luck getting a relaxing holiday sleep here. The rooms are all nicely decorated but with zero thoughts about where the lights should be, the shelf over the sink [revents you from using it and the safe was inoperable. Its a shame because the bar staff were friendly and engaging and the location near to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia is excellent. The restaurant evening food was very poor and we would recommend against. We'd recommend the Oceans Seven restaurant just around the corner where the service and food were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely hotel if you get a nice room”
Reviews.Author: Damaskfan
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 excellence rooms, our friends received this level of room immediately and we were told we would be transferred into one the following day. (No refund for the one night!). Our first room was a reasonable size and looked out over the street. Our friends room had a stunning view out over the water but was small. Additionally, their air conditioning didn't work and it was always tomorrow it would be repaired, needless to say it never was. All the balconies are small and fully open to your neigbours balcony, however, it is nice to have access to the open air. Breakfast can be had indoors or out and the seating area is lovely. There is plenty of continental style food to fill yourself each morning. I wouldn't go for the fancy looking biscuits - no taste just calories! There's a rooftop restaurant and bar - a lovely spot for a drink and a gaze at the view. We didn't try the food there so can't comment. Overbooking and moving people during their stay seems common here and judging from previous reviews there are some bad rooms to be had. This hotel is a little gem if you land in a good room. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is convenient for the main sites and there is easy access to the rest of the city. A little wander though the streets can take you to the waterfront too. Just beware of the chap outside the Best Western Obelisk Hotel when you go out in an evening. He can be more than a little touchy if you choose not to eat in the Obelisk Restaurant. If he's rude don't take him personally it seems to be like to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Family-home”
Reviews.Author: riki13
Reviews.Content: This house we can only recomend to everyone. For every Question they have an answer, and this friendly and perfect from breakfast till three in the morning. I would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Trainspotting Heaven”
Reviews.Author: RoryOxford
Reviews.Content: Insist on a room in the annexe of this centrally located boutique hotel only if you into 24 hour trainspotting. With frequent passenger and freight trains rattling at what seems to be little more than arm length away from your window; this is hotel is truly a trainspotting heaven. Unless you have money to burn and want a bad time, I recommend avoiding any restaurant recommended by the dyed-blonde receptionist or the 'deputy manager' who uses the name of Cengiz Somer.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4...small for families”
Reviews.Author: TicF16
Reviews.Content: We had to squeeze our 3 children into one room...it was tight, but the room was clean, the staff friendly, and the location great (although we had to walk up hill to the sights every day).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay IF you get the right room.”
Reviews.Author: JimboEastBoldon
Reviews.Content: I can concur with the majority of positive revues already posted but as many others found there are a number of very poor rooms. Those located down the 3 flights of stairs, although well presented are very small with shoe boxes for bathrooms. The biggest problem, however, is the busy railway line about 5 paces from your window. If you make a big enough fuss they will change you, probably the next day. The rest of the hotel is fine with quality fittings but don't expect too much space. It is well situated in a pleasant area and within minutes walk of some of the biggest sights.and dozens of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant weekend!”
Reviews.Author: blue07
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent deal to go to this hotel online for 3nts.I emailed the hotel for transfer and also told them I wanted smoking room.Their response was very quick and as non-smoking hotel reserved room with balcony :). Room given was very good,abit on the small side but have been to Istanbul before and I don't think you get big rooms anyway. I was a bit wary of the complaints re; railway and Yes you can hear the trains from practically all rooms I think -but this was not a problem to us.Hotel in excellent position for the "must sees" although we went purposefully to do Bospherous cruise and to visit friends.The breakfast (is downstairs in a very pleasant room with garden attached) and consisted of cereals,bread/toast,cold meats,cheeses and biscuits/pastries,fruit,so no need to go hungry. The restaurant/bar looked lovely with great views on balcony but we never made it there-haha- have to go again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: trekker58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have recently spent 5 days at the Avicenna on a recommendation and have to say the overall experience was a great one. We originally were booked in a room on the second floor, but as my husband has a back problem and found the steps difficult the staff went out of their way to get us another room on the first floor. We found the staff to be extremely helpfull and pleasant, the breakfast adequate and the rooms spotless. Like most "European" hotel rooms they are on the "compact" side, but only because we are used to much larger room size in New Zealand. The position of the hotel us so convenient and we were so central to most attractions and very good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Just like sleeping on a railway track”
Reviews.Author: Deesee76
Reviews.Content: Firstly, we seldomly complain about the quality of our hotels but please read this so you can spend your money elsewhere. This is our 3rd visit to Istanbul and our experience at this hotel was terrible. We were enroute back to London after 9 lovely days in the regional Turkey and thought I would treat my family to a boutique hotel on our last night My wife and I managed to get 5 hours of sleep as we were assigned with a room down in the basement (non-street facing side, back of the block - note that majority of the rooms are in this block). When we open the curtain, the train tracks were just 3 metres from the window (please refer to my photos). We requested a room change 3 times and we were simply brushed off by a number of staff during our stay. They did not even offer a discount or reimbursement or any sort of compensation. Luckily, my parents who are in their mid-60s were given a room on the street side. The person working at the lobby claimed that their room was upgraded but it was exactly same size as ours so it was not actually an upgrade aside from being on the street side. Worst, we were told the trains will stop running after 8pm and this went on and on until 12am, before the first train screamed past our window at 5am. We called at 8, 10, 11 and 12am and got the same story, "Sir, it will stop soon, it is the last train". When your window, bed and floor shakes when a train comes past every 10 minutes, this is simply unacceptable for a room with Â£172.50 per night price tag. To be fair, this hotel is very well renovated and it has excellent chill-out areas, outdoor area, breakfast room. For the price we paid, this is irrelevant when you can't sleep. I spoke to a number of clients in the hotel in the morning and they were also shocked at the noise and vibration of the room from the passing trains.

Reviews.Title: “a very mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: christina50
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews which were good. Sure the location is very near the sights and great from that point of view, it is clean, breakfast was good and the staff friendly but nonone seems to have mentioned the train line which ran right next to the room we were first put in. This room was in the basement- it was tiny with nowhere to put anything and the smallest bathroom and shower I have ever seen. We were on the same level as the trains and the window looked onto the railway line- so quiet it was not. We manged to get a room change after the first night but there was a confusion and we were allocated the same room as Spanish couple who were also trying to get a change of room and who were very upset that they were paying the same as a relative who had a more spacious room with balcony. The problem is that the hotel is in 2 parts and if you are in the main bit the rooms are much better- but when the hotel is full the rooms in the block at the back and especially in the basement are not good at all. Having said this the receptionist was very friendly and tried to be helpful- we said we were returning for another stay after a trip to Cyprus and asked to be allocated a better room. On our retrun we were told there was no room for us as they had a problem with a wall falling down- we never got the full story. Now for the good news- we were put up instead at a very nearby hotel called the Darussaade- a very newly renovated gem- boutique hotel-19th Century house- We had a room with views over the bosphous and blue mosque- its probably more expensive but I would suggest it as alternative. But have to say thanks to the Avicenna for putting us there.
